tasks.title: [Uno Lighting] Monitor campaigns for budget increase readiness (£1,800/day approved, waiting for capacity)
tasks.notes:
---
**Source:** Client Agreement (2025-11-12)
**Client:** uno-lighting
**Priority:** P2 (Monitoring - not urgent)
**Time Estimate:** 45 mins
**Reason:** Richard agreed to full £500/day budget increase via WhatsApp on Nov 12. Implementation deferred until campaigns show budget constraint.
---

**UPDATE (2025-11-19):** Still no budget constraint - campaigns operating well below capacity.
- **Today's spend:** £598/day (45% of £1,330 total budget)

- **Main H&S PMax:** £354/day (48% of £730 budget)
- **Shopping:** £172/day (43% of £400 budget)
- **Villains:** £58/day (53% of £110 budget)
- **Conclusion:** Continue monitoring - no action needed yet

**UPDATE (2025-11-14):** No capacity yet in campaigns to accommodate new budget. Need to check again Tuesday next week.

**STRATEGY (2025-11-13):** Monitor daily - implement £500/day increase ONLY when budget constraint appears
- **Current Status:** NOT budget-limited (0% budget lost impression share)
- **Trigger:** When budget lost IS rises above 10% consistently OR peak demand drives spend to limits
- **Current Spend:** £598/day (well below £1,330 approved limit)

**Budget Allocation (when triggered):**
- Main PMax: Increase budget (pending capacity)
- Shopping: Increase to address impression loss (pending capacity)
- Brand: Maintain strong 3x ROAS performance
- Villains: Enable new customer acquisition (pending capacity)

**Expected Revenue:** £5,400/day at 300% ROAS = £130k (Nov 13 - Dec 6)

**Next Steps:**
1. Check again Thursday Nov 21 (approaching Black Friday week)
2. Monitor for Black Friday demand surge
3. Implement budget increase if capacity appears
4. Alert client if ROAS drops below 200%
5. Confirm implementation to Richard via WhatsApp when triggered

**UPDATE (2025-11-19 Evening):** Still no budget constraint - continue monitoring.
- Manual check confirmed no activity requiring budget increase
- Next review: Monday Nov 25 (Black Friday week approach)
